subject: Api changes in AddReportFuture version
commitMessage:
Api changes in AddReportFuture version

Added support for CollectionFunction, CollectionDuration,
CollectionTimeScope, ReportUpdates, AppendLimit.

New API separates Id and Name, user can decide to pass only Name
to auto generate Id or pass Id which needs to be unique.

Tested:
- No functional changes to old API, everything works as before
- All use cases can be replaced with new API to achieve same results
- New features which require new API work as expected

Signed-off-by: Krzysztof Grobelny <krzysztof.grobelny@intel.com>
Change-Id: I647efab36d90a548754f89968223e162a087481e

This code is very hard to read and check, is it possible to use here structured binding with clear variable names? It will cost a little more code but IMO it will be much more readable.
Done

Szymon has added dbusIface.register_property_rw for 'Name' in Triggers in Telemetry code, maybe we could discuss which approach for the dbus interface of this property is to prevail and will be consistent within Telemetry?
I will change it in separate commit
Ack

Will it be better for performance to use the previous method - by using fileName variable and call this hash calc only once? When one approach is accepted then I suggest to use it for both Reports and Triggers.

It's once, when report is created and stored. It should not affect performance, on the other hand we don't keep file name in memory.

I will change it in Triggers as separate commit.
Ack
Please double check this one, if I remember correctly Piotr had mentioned that the default operation type should be 'Average'.
Done
It is difficult to understand this fragment without diving more into the code, maybe using clear variable names with structured binding could improve this a little?
Done

I know that changing this property name to "ReportIds" could potentially break things, but how about creating it as separate, duplicated property? We could remove "ReportNames" once we make sure that all dependencies are using new property.
I will change it in separate commit
nit: I know that it was my idea, but the longer I look at this, the more I feel regret that I didn't use some mathematical or lookup-table count_digits() solution 😭
